text:
In addition to reducing the amount of investment overall, unethical behavior—such
as providing incomplete, misleading, or false information to investors—can affect the
allocation of the capital that is raised. Misallocation of capital to businesses other than
those with the most potential for growth and societal benefit reduces the growth of an
economy and the well-being of its people. When the allocation of investment capital is
constrained or inefficient, the negative consequences extend to all the participants in an
economy.
